intro: Pavetta tonkinensis var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy pavetta, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels. The fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, typical of the genus Pavetta.
